title: Sources: Warriors expect Butler to play Game 4
content: The Warriors are expecting Jimmy Butler to make his return Monday night in Game 4 against the Rockets, sources told ESPN.

title: Source: WR Johnson to Browns after strange '24
content: The Browns reached agreement on a one-year contract with free agent wide receiver Diontae Johnson on Monday.

title: Trump: Penn violated Title IX with trans swimmer
content: The Trump administration said Monday that the University of Pennsylvania violated laws guaranteeing women equal opportunities in athletics by letting a transgender swimmer compete on the school's women's team and into team facilities.

title: NBA says Doncic was fouled late in Lakers' G4 loss
content: Referees missed the Lakers' Luka Doncic getting fouled with 33 seconds left in Game 4 of their playoff series against the Timberwolves, the NBA said Monday.

title: Clark feeling 'stronger'; Fever camp vibes 'good'
content: The revamped Fever opened training camp with really good vibes, according to Caitlin Clark, who says she's feelings stronger following the offseason.

title: Bucks' Lillard tears Achilles; '25-'26 in jeopardy
content: Bucks star Damian Lillard has a torn left Achilles tendon and will undergo surgery. The injury ends his season and puts his 2025-26 season in jeopardy.

title: Now in LF, Altuve asks off Astros' leadoff spot
content: Houston star Jose Altuve asked Astros manager Joe Espada to move him out of the leadoff spot and into the second hole because he'd like more time to run to the dugout from left field, where he is playing left for the first time in his 14-year MLB career.

title: USC's Arenas avoids major injuries from crash
content: Alijah Arenas, a basketball recruit for USC, is expected to be released from the hospital with no major injuries following a car crash Thursday morning.

title: Steph and Draymond's 'last ride' comes down to Playoff Jimmy
content: Ten years after their first title, Curry and Green know Butler is the key to their pursuit of a fifth ring.

title: After a disappointing weekend, the power now belongs to Shedeur Sanders
content: From here on out, all that matters for Shedeur Sanders is proving the Browns were right in selecting him.

title: How Arne Slot, Liverpool won the Premier League
content: It seemed impossible to follow club legend Jurgen Klopp and win the league in his first year, but Arne Slot has done just that at Liverpool.

title: Liverpool waited 35 years for this party
content: Liverpool waited 30 years and then won the Prem during a pandemic. This time they can finally celebrate.

title: White Sox unveil Bulls-inspired first-of-its-kind City Connect uniforms
content: The latest City Connect uniform is the first on-field look that combines brand elements from MLB and the NBA.

title: Barcelona win dramatic Copa del Rey clásico, Liverpool clinch Premier League, more
content: Barcelona and Real Madrid didn't disappoint in a drama-filled Copa del Rey final, Liverpool finally clinched the Premier League and Inter Milan are wobbling at the worst time: Gab Marcotti recaps the weekend.

title: Martinelli open to battle as Arsenal eye striker
content: Gabriel Martinelli has suggested Arsenal need to bolster their attack this summer and welcomes the competition for places any new arrivals would bring.

title: Luis Enrique blasts media ahead of Arsenal SF
content: Luis Enrique has hit back at what he believes is unfair negativity surrounding his Paris Saint-Germain side on the eve of their Champions League semifinal against Arsenal.

title: Source: Villa fear Rashford out for the season
content: Villa fear Rashford could miss the rest of the season with the hamstring injury which kept him out of the FA Cup semifinal, a source has told ESPN.

title: Germany's Völler on Rüdiger red: 'Can't do that'
content: Antonio Rüdiger needs to show "class" and respect for others, German national team sporting director Rudi Völler has said, after the defender appeared to throw ice toward the referee during Real Madrid's Copa del Rey loss to Barcelona.

title: Arteta urges Arsenal to 'live the moment' vs. PSG
content: Mikel Arteta said Arsenal are feeling the weight of history, but urged his players to "live the moment" as they attempt to reach the Champions League final.

title: Source: Saints mull Minnesota's Ramsay as coach
content: Southampton have made contact with Minnesota United boss Eric Ramsay as they continue their search for a new manager, a source has told ESPN.

title: 'Welcome to Wrexham' Season 4 trailer unveiled
content: The official trailer of the fourth season of hit FX series "Welcome to Wrexham" has been unveiled by Disney+ ahead of its release next month.

title: MLS investigating discrimination in Vancouver win
content: MLS announced it is aware of a reported violation of the league's Non-Discrimination Policy that occurred in Sunday's match between Minnesota United FC and the Vancouver Whitecaps, and will "immediately begin a thorough review of the matter."

title: UFC 318 reactions: What would a BMF title win mean for Dustin Poirier?
content: Dustin Poirier will take on ex-featherweight champion Max Holloway one last time for the BMF title at UFC 318.

title: Chelsea going backwards in UWCL as quadruple hopes crushed by Barcelona
content: Chelsea appeared closer than ever to winning the Champions League, but after a crushing defeat to Barcelona, they now seem further away than ever.

title: Eubank Jr. should focus on Canelo, rather than Benn rematch
content: Forget a rematch with Conor Benn, the focus for Chris Eubank Jr should now fully be on Canelo Alvarez

title: MLS Power Rankings: Vancouver, Miami still top; Portland hits form
content: After a sluggish start, the Portland Timbers are closing in on the elite teams in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Wrexham's latest promotion is a miracle. The next will be even harder
content: Wrexham's third straight promotion has them on the Premier League's doorstep. Getting there will be much harder.

title: Should you draft Caitlin Clark or A'ja Wilson at No. 1?
content: A'ja Wilson opened as the top ranked player in fantasy women's basketball entering the 2025 season, but does someone else have a case to supplant Wilson in 2025?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man Utd to trigger Cunha's $84M release clause
content: Is Matheus Cunha the man to solve Manchester United's attacking woes? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: US Lost Seven Multi-Million-Dollar Drones In Yemen Area Since March
content: The United States has lost seven multi-million-dollar MQ-9 Reaper drones in the Yemen area since March 15, a US official said Monday, as the Navy announced a costly warplane fell off an aircraft carrier into the Red Sea.

title: 11 Passenger Trains Stranded In Spain Power Blackout: Ministry
content: Nearly nine hours after a blackout brought the Iberian peninsula to a standstill Monday, Spain's transport minister said 11 trains remained stranded with passengers on board.

title: Israel's Shin Bet Intelligence Chief Announces Resignation: Report
content: The head of Israel's domestic intelligence service, Ronen Bar, has announced his resignation and will step down on June 15, Israeli media reported late on Monday, six weeks after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu tried to oust the security chief.

title: Iran Minister Blames "Negligence" For Port Blast That Killed 70
content: Iran's interior minister on Monday blamed "negligence" for a massive explosion that killed 70 people at the country's largest commercial port, with firefighters still battling a blaze at the facility two days later.

title: Zelensky Calls Putin Truce Proposal "Attempt At Manipulation"
content: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky on Monday branded a three-day truce announced by his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin as an "attempt at manipulation".

title: Explainer: What Are The Potential Outcomes Of Canada's General Election?
content: Canada is queuing up to vote in the general election being held today, with polls indicating Prime Minister Mark Carney's ruling Liberals ahead of the official opposition Conservatives of Pierre Poilievre.

title: Canadian Election 2025 LIVE: Who Will Be New PM- Liberal Mark Carney Or Conservative Pierre Poilievre
content: Canadians are voting today to decide whether to extend the Prime Minister Mark Carney-led Liberal Party's decade in power or hand over the country's control to Pierre Poilievre's Conservative Party.

title: 20% Of Electricity Restored In Spain: Operator
content: More than 20 percent of Spain's power capacity has been restored, the country's REE electricity operator said late Monday as it battled to overcome a major outage that has hit Spain and Portugal.

title: Upset Over Not Being Served Paneer, Man Drives Bus Over Wedding Guests In UP
content: A man crashed a minibus in a wedding hall, injuring six people and damaging goods worth Rs 3 lakh in Uttar Pradesh's Chandauli district. Reason: He didn't get paneer in the wedding feast.

title: In Video, Unaware Tourist On Zipline Captures Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: A tourist who was on a zipline ride during a trip to Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam last week inadvertently captured the terrorist attack that left 26 civilians dead, according to a new video that has emerged on social media.

title: President Presents Padma Awards. Shekhar Kapur, S Ajith, R Ashwin Among Awardees
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Monday conferred the prestigious Padma Awards to 71 distinguished individuals at the Civil Investiture Ceremony held at the Rashtrapati Bhawan's Durbar Hall.

title: Empty Shelves? US Official Not Concerned 'At Present' Over Tariff Impact
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said Monday he was not concerned "at present" about American stores potentially running out of items due to President Donald Trump's tariffs.

title: Highlights: Millions Across Spain, Portugal Face Sudden Power Outage
content: Spain Power Outage: Millions are facing a power outage in Spain, Portugal and parts of southern France. The cause for the outage was not immediately identified.

title: Government Mulls Guidelines On Labelling 'Analogue Paneer' In Hotels, Restaurants
content: The Consumer Affairs Ministry is considering issuing guidelines to require hotels and restaurants to clearly mention when they use "analogue paneer" in the dishes served to customers, a top government official said on Monday.

title: Man, 47, Rapes 8-Year-Old Girl During Wedding Ceremony In UP, Arrested: Cops
content: A 47-year-old man was arrested and sent to jail on Monday, four days after he allegedly raped an eight-year-old girl during a wedding ceremony here, police said.

title: Karnataka High Court Cancels Case Against Infosys Co-Founder Kris Gopalakrishnan
content: The Karnataka High Court has quashed an FIR registered against Infosys co-founder Kris Gopalakrishnan and others under the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act, 1989.

title: Former Rajasthan Minister's Wife Dies While He Is In Probe Agency's Custody
content: Former Rajasthan minister and Congress leader Mahesh Joshi's wife Kaushal Joshi passed away after prolonged illness at a hospital in Jaipur on Monday morning, sources said.

title: How Canadians Seek To 'Send A Message' To Trump
content: A volunteer checking registrations and directing voters past yellow election signs to the correct booths said it was the busiest balloting they had ever witnessed, adding many first-time voters had showed up.

title: "Truth Stands Tall": Congress Leader On Court Order On CWG Corruption Case
content: Congress leader Pawan Khera on Monday targeted the BJP after a Delhi Court formally closed the Enforcement Directorate (ED) investigation into alleged money laundering tied to the 2010 Commonwealth Games (CWG) corruption case.

title: Trump Trade War Dominates BRICS Meeting In Brazil
content: The foreign ministers of Brazil, China, Russia and other BRICS members began two days of talks in Rio de Janeiro Monday aimed at forging a united front to US President Donald Trump's aggressive trade policies.

title: India 5th largest military spender; expenditure 9 times more than Pakistan
content: Global military spending surged to a record $2.718 trillion in 2024, marking the steepest increase since the Cold War. India ranks as the fifth-largest military spender, allocating $86 billion, but faces challenges from China and Pakistan.

title: India briefs Taliban; Afghanistan govt condemns Pahalgam attack
content: India briefed the Taliban regime about Pakistan's involvement in the Pahalgam attack, seeking international support against cross-border terrorism. The Taliban's acting foreign minister condemned the attack and emphasized the need for accountability. This meeting highlights improving India-Taliban relations amidst escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, primarily due to Pakistan's alleged support for terrorist activities.

title: SC relief to mom who killed 2 kids under 'spell of invisible powers'
content: The Supreme Court overturned a woman's murder conviction for killing her two daughters in Chhattisgarh, citing a lack of intent due to a possible temporary mental disorder. The court acknowledged her claims of being possessed by 'invisible powers' and the prevalence of superstition in rural areas, leading to misinterpretations of mental illness.

title: Pahalgam massacre: Pakistani terrorist former para commando, says probe
content: Investigations reveal Hashim Musa, the Pakistani terrorist behind the Pahalgam massacre, is a former para commando from Pakistan's special forces. Sources indicate Musa, now with LeT, was deployed to J&K to target non-locals and security forces.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk is not 'happy', says 'We should have been ... '
content: Elon Musk expressed his disappointment that humans haven't reached Mars yet, despite SpaceX's efforts. He referenced the rapid progress from the first flight to the moon landing, highlighting the current delay in space exploration.

title: Curse be upon me if I ask for statehood now: J&K CM Omar Abdullah
content: In a poignant assembly session, J&K CM Omar Abdullah vowed not to exploit the Pahalgam terrorist attack, which claimed 26 lives, for political gain. Visibly emotional, he condemned the attack and emphasized solidarity, rejecting demands to leverage the tragedy for statehood. National Conference president Farooq Abdullah asserted that Pakistan's actions had eliminated any possibility for dialogue.

title: India to get all 26 Rafale-M jets by 2030 under Rs 63,887 crore pact with France
content: India has finalized a significant deal with France, procuring 26 Rafale-Marine jets for approximately Euro 7 billion. Deliveries are scheduled from mid-2028 to 2030, enhancing the Indian Navy's capabilities, especially for aircraft carrier operations. This acquisition aims to counter China's growing naval presence in the Indian Ocean, providing a substantial boost to India's maritime air power.

title: J&K: Cross-LoC fire spreads from Valley to Jammu
content: The ceasefire along the Line of Control with Pakistan is increasingly strained, escalating beyond Kashmir to the Jammu region following the Pahalgam massacre. Despite this, the situation hasn't reached the intensity of pre-2021 artillery duels. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh met with PM Modi to discuss potential military responses, including limited punitive strikes against Pakistan, as ceasefire violations rise.

title: Bill Gates' $16m gift to daughter defied Melinda's middle-class upbringing for kids
content: Bill Gates reportedly gifted his daughter Jennifer a $15.82 million horse farm in North Salem, Westchester, following her Stanford graduation in 2018. The estate, equipped with equestrian facilities, supports Jennifer's passion for competitive horse riding. This purchase contrasts with Melinda Gates' past statements emphasizing a modest upbringing for their children, sparking discussions about wealth and values within the family.

title: Congress tells its netas to rein in comments
content: Amidst BJP's criticism of Congress leaders questioning the necessity of conflict with Pakistan and challenging the Pahalgam victims' accounts, Congress has distanced itself from these statements. Jairam Ramesh clarified that individual remarks don't reflect the party's stance.

title: Banke Bihari rejects 'Muslim boycott' call
content: Vrindavan's Banke Bihari temple has rejected calls from right-wing groups to boycott Muslim artisans following the Pahalgam attack. Temple authorities emphasized the significant contributions of Muslim weavers and artisans, who have been crafting the deity's attire and accessories for decades.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's ton moves Dravid out of his wheelchair
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, etched his name in IPL history by becoming the youngest centurion. Representing Rajasthan Royals, he blazed his way to a century in just 35 balls against Gujarat Titans at the Swaiman Singh Stadium. The record of fastest century in IPL belongs to former West Indies batter Chris Gayle, who had brought up his triple figure mark in 30 balls for Royal Challengers Bengaluru against Pune Warriors in April 2013.

title: LinkedIn co-founder to staff: Go home, dine with family, and then open laptops to ...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman believes work-life balance is incompatible with startup success, advocating for a relentless work ethic. He argues that those prioritizing balance are not fully committed to winning, emphasizing the intense demands of the startup environment. Hoffman points to the financial rewards reaped by early LinkedIn employees as justification for his demanding approach.

title: Courts of Kazi, Kajiyat & Sharia have no legal status: SC
content: The Supreme Court has reaffirmed that 'Court of Kazi', 'Darul Kaja Kajiyat', and 'Sharia Court' lack legal standing, rendering their declarations, including fatwas, non-binding and unenforceable. This reiteration came while the court addressed a Muslim woman's maintenance plea, overturning lower court decisions that denied her support based on assumptions about second marriages and dowry demands.

title: IIT-Delhi tasked with ground survey of waqf properties to plug gaps in data
content: The government has tasked IIT-Delhi with a sample survey of waqf properties due to severely lacking survey data, despite ongoing digitisation efforts. The assessment report, expected in two months, will help create a standardised survey template for states to improve data collection and management.

title: Cyber espionage? HC forms SIT to probe data theft at drone firm
content: The Karnataka High Court has established a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to investigate a data theft case at NewSpace Research and Technologies, a drone manufacturing company. This action follows a complaint that former employees stole sensitive data, potentially compromising national security.

title: Carbon-heavy sectors handed green targets, liable to fines
content: India's high-emission industries, including aluminum, cement, and pulp & paper, face mandatory greenhouse gas emission intensity reduction targets starting 2025-26. The environment ministry's draft notification, covering 282 entities, introduces penalties for non-compliance. These industries will need to purchase carbon credits if they fail to meet the specified targets under the Carbon Credit Trading Scheme.

title: Delhi court extends NIA custody of 26/11 plotter Rana by 12 days
content: A Delhi court has extended the NIA custody of Tahawwur Rana, an accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack, by 12 days. The NIA sought the extension to confront Rana with evidence and investigate the conspiracy's full extent, citing non-cooperation. Rana's plea for telephonic access to his family was dismissed due to concerns about jeopardizing the ongoing investigation.

title: Govt eyes battery-swap hubs to ease long journeys for EVs
content: The government is planning subsidies for battery swapping stations to facilitate long-distance electric vehicle travel, particularly for buses and trucks. Initially, the subsidy will focus on these vehicles, along with two and three-wheelers, as car battery swapping standards are still being developed. This initiative aligns with the increasing adoption of EVs and the establishment of charging infrastructure along national highways.

title: Pahalgam may spell end of medical tourism from Pakistan
content: Deteriorating Indo-Pak relations and heightened security concerns have drastically reduced medical visas issued to Pakistani nationals seeking treatment in India. From over 1,600 visas in 2016, the number plummeted to just over 200 in 2024, a trend exacerbated by events like the Kulbhushan Jadhav case and the Pulwama attack.

title: Somnath encroachment case: SC asks Gujarat govt to keep wall height at 5-6 ft
content: The Supreme Court questioned the Gujarat government's need for a 12-foot wall around land near the Somnath temple, recently cleared of encroachment, including a dargah. Justices Gavai and Masih suggested a more reasonable 5-6 foot wall to prevent further encroachment. Solicitor General Tushar Mehta assured the court that no religious activities were permitted on the government land.

title: BJP slams Cong brass for failing to contain controversial remarks on Pahalgam by partymen
content: BJP intensified its criticism of Congress following controversial remarks by its leaders regarding the Pahalgam massacre. BJP leaders demanded clarification from Mallikarjun Kharge and Rahul Gandhi on claims that victims were not religiously profiled. BJP condemned the insensitivity of Congress leaders, questioning the truthfulness of victims' families' accounts.

title: CM Siddaramaiah 'threatens' to hit cop during Congress rally
content: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah faced accusations of threatening a police officer during a Congress rally in Belagavi after BJP workers breached security and protested on stage. Siddaramaiah, visibly agitated, questioned the officer's actions and demanded the removal of the protesters while AICC general secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala and law and parliamentary affairs minister HK Patil tried to calm him.

title: Siachen base camp now a tourist zone, Galwan Valley to open on June 15
content: The Siachen base camp is now accessible to tourists without prior authorization, announced Tashi Gyalson, CEC of LAHDC, Leh, following the early reopening of Zojila Pass on April 1, 2025.

title: MP: 5 more cheetah cubs born at Kuno, tourism zooms
content: The reintroduction of cheetahs in Kuno National Park has significantly boosted tourism, with footfall increasing by over 120% and revenue more than doubling. This surge is transforming Sheopur and Mandsaur districts, once known for banditry and opium cultivation, into thriving wildlife destinations.

title: SC says HC prima facie correct in impleading govt, ASI in Mathura row
content: The Supreme Court stated that the Allahabad High Court was initially correct in permitting Hindu litigants to include the Centre and the Archaeological Survey of India in the Mathura Krishna Janmabhoomi-Shahi Idgah dispute. The Allahabad HC had allowed amendments to lawsuits, enabling petitioners to include the home ministry and ASI as respondents.

title: Suryavanshi youngest ever to score T20 hundred, fastest Indian to IPL ton
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Rajasthan Royals player, made history. He scored the youngest T20 century ever. Suryavanshi also achieved the fastest IPL hundred by an Indian. He reached his century in just 35 balls against Gujarat Titans. His innings included 11 sixes. He scored 101 runs off 38 balls. Rajasthan Royals had a strong start thanks to his performance.

title: Pahalgam horror caught on cam: Zipliner inadvertently records terror attack
content: A chilling video has emerged from the Pahalgam terror attack that killed 26, capturing a tourist ziplining, oblivious to the unfolding violence. Gunshots echoed in the background as terrorists targeted tourists in Baisaran meadow, marking one of the region's deadliest incidents since the 2019 Pulwama attack. In response, India has taken stringent measures, including halting the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan

title: NDA govt. using SIT as political tool in liquor case, allege YSRCP leader
content: The case originated merely from letters sent by an unknown individual, “Venkateswara Srinivas,” with no proven connection to the liquor trade.

title: He taught us to go the extra distance in capturing a frame: Sunny Joseph on Shaji N.Karun
content: Veteran cinematographers like him instilled the courage in the people who followed them to take a few risks and go the extra distance in capturing a frame.

title: Female Tribal Students to participate in long march for not receiving accommodation in govt hostels
content: Student Federation of India (SFI) held several discussions with the tribal department for the accommodation of these girls in government hostels.

title: Maharashtra Congress alleges irregularities in MHT-CET State exams, writes to CM to seek a probe
content: Maharashtra Congress State president Harshvardhan Sapkal wrote a letter to Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis demanding investigation in the alleged irregularities in the State-level common entrance examination.

title: 1,815 students admitted to colleges last year, including three from MBBS course, wrote CET again this year
content: Karnataka Examinations Authority takes steps to monitor these candidates in the wake of the alleged engineering seat blocking scam last year

title: Fighter jet slides off US aircraft carrier deck into Red Sea
content: A United States Navy F/A-18E Super Hornet went into the Red Sea from the USS Harry S Truman. The incident happened during towing operations inside the carrier. The towing crew lost control, leading to the jet and tow tractor falling overboard. Sailors escaped with one minor injury. An investigation is currently underway to determine the cause.

title: Shashi Tharoor faces flak from his party over Pahalgam remark
content: Shashi Tharoor faced internal criticism after commenting on the Pahalgam attack, stating that no country can have "foolproof, 100% intelligence." Udit Raj questioned Tharoor's remarks, accusing him of providing a clean chit to the BJP government despite their admission of security lapses.

title: 3rd Tamil Nadu minister to face graft trial after HC nixes discharge order
content: I Periyasamy, Tamil Nadu's rural development minister, will face trial in a disproportionate assets case after the Madras High Court overturned a Dindigul court's discharge order. The court directed the special court to reopen proceedings against Periyasamy, who is accused of amassing assets with his family between 2006 and 2010.

title: Sedition charge on Lucknow University prof over Pahalgam post
content: Lucknow University teacher Madri Kakoti, known online as Dr Medusa, faces sedition charges following a social media post about the Pahalgam attack. An ABVP member filed a complaint, alleging her remarks promoted disharmony. Kakoti defends her statement as a factual observation about acts constituting terror, while the university issued a show-cause notice after student protests.

title: Some regulation on OTT needed but govt to take a call: SC
content: The Supreme Court expressed concerns about objectionable content on OTT and social media platforms, accessible even to children. The court urged the Centre to regulate these platforms through legislative or executive action. While refraining from immediate intervention, the SC issued notices to platforms like Netflix, Amazon Prime, X, and Google, and will monitor the government's actions.

title: 'Fears being treated like Zelenskyy': Why Xi is 'ghosting' Trump
content: China refuted President Trump's claim of recent tariff talks with Xi Jinping, escalating trade war tensions. This denial raises concerns about the global economy and Trump's strategy, as direct leader dialogue is absent. China's refusal to engage suggests a readiness to endure economic pain, while Trump's credibility faces scrutiny amid conflicting reports.

title: The sacrifices Vaibhav Suryavanshi made to become IPL's fastest Indian centurion
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy from Bihar, etched his name in IPL history, smashing a record-breaking century for Rajasthan Royals. He became the youngest player to achieve this feat, scoring 101 off 38 balls against Gujarat Titans. Suryavanshi's explosive innings, featuring 11 sixes, led his team to a comfortable victory.

title: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's record-breaking ton powers Rajasthan Royals to thumping win
content: Rajasthan Royals witnessed a historic moment as 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi smashed a record-breaking 101 off 38 balls against Gujarat Titans. His explosive innings, featuring 11 sixes, propelled the Royals to an eight-wicket victory. Suryavanshi's century is the fastest in IPL history by an Indian and the youngest in T20 cricket, overshadowing Shubman Gill's earlier impressive score.

title: 'Will use n-arsenal if ...': Pak min after claiming India invasion imminent
content: Following the deadly Pahalgam terrorist attack that killed 26, Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif claimed an imminent Indian incursion, prompting heightened alert and reinforcement of forces. India's defence minister Rajnath Singh met with Prime Minister Modi to discuss counter-terrorism strategies after the attack. Nationwide protests have erupted, demanding strong action against Pakistan for supporting terrorism.

title: 'Kargil mein bhi haraya tha': Shikhar Dhawan destroys Shahid Afridi
content: Shikhar Dhawan has strongly condemned Shahid Afridi's remarks blaming the Indian Army for the Pahalgam terror attack. Afridi questioned the army's efficiency and Pakistan's alleged involvement, drawing sharp criticism. Dhawan reminded Afridi of India's victory in Kargil and urged him to focus on his own country's progress instead of making baseless comments. He also expressed pride in the Indian Army.

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Demolition drive paused in Kashmir but crackdown on supporters of terrorists intensified
content: The Centre has taken note of the regional parties’ concern over demolitions in Kashmir and was reviewing such measures, say sources in State government

title: Five days on, Pakistan yet to communicate with India whereabouts of detained BSF jawan
content: The jawan, P.K. Sahu, a resident of West Bengal, had crossed four or five metres into Pakistan while accompanying farmers

title: Kannur University’s internal mark entry system collapses
content: The failure, coming amid ongoing errors in the university’s examination system, has further deepened the academic crisis

title: Trained non-Brahmin archakas demand stipend of ₹15,000
content: They were trained in schools at temples under the purview of the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments Department

title: Mano Thangaraj re-inducted into Cabinet as Milk and Dairy Development Minister
content: This is part of the reshuffle that was necessitated after K. Ponmudy and V. Senthilbalaji resigned as Ministers on Sunday

title: T.N. government to reduce interest for late payment of property tax arrears in urban local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Urban Local Bodies Act has been tabled in the Assembly. It seeks to impose 0.5% interest on unpaid property tax, simplify procedures for issuing business licences

title: Speaking at the Assembly, Palaniswami raises concern over rise of grave crimes in Tamil Nadu
content: He says fresh investigation will be ordered into Anna University sexual assault case if AIADMK returns to power in 2026

title: Drunk men thrash policeman and tear uniform at Bhopal railway station; one held, two at large
content: A purported video of the incident has also surfaced on social media showing a group of men pushing, aggressively punching and abusing constable Nazar Daulat Khan

title: Modi to inaugurate first media-entertainment ‘WAVES’ summit in Mumbai
content: Bringing together officials from 33 countries and numerous industry leaders, the World Audio Visual Entertainment Summit (WAVES) will begin on May 1

title: Pahalgam terror attack: Long-term and diplomatic visas of Pakistani nationals valid, say officials
content: Officials clarified that of the 16 categories of visas issued to Pakistan nationals, two categories would remain valid after April 29 and that validity of the LTVs will not be impacted by the religious identity of the visa holders

title: T.N. government to regulate hoardings, digital banners, and placards in rural local bodies
content: A Bill to amend the Tamil Nadu Panchayats Act, 1994, accordingly was tabled by Minister for Rural Development I. Periyasamy in the Assembly on Monday

title: ₹20,000 costs imposed on petitioners seeking re-evaluation of Group-I mains scripts
content: Counsel for TGPSC pointed out that the person whose case was referred by the petitioners had not contested his revaluation resultsand was not among the petitioners

title: In 2024, India's military expenditure was nearly 9 times that of Pakistan: Swedish think-tank SIPRI
content: The country’s military expenditure, the fifth largest globally, grew by 1.6% to $86.1 billion while Pakistan spent $10.2 billion, according to the Stockholm International Peace Research Institute (SIPRI)

title: Now, tourism as a weapon against terrorism
content: Sources said the Ministry of External Affairs is also joining the effort by appealing to countries that issued travel advisories telling their citizens not to visit Jammu and Kashmir after the Pahalgam terror attack

title: Two booked for thrashing man on train over watching video on Pahalgam attack
content: The Government Railway Police in Madhya Pradesh said they are working to identify the two accused through CCTV footage

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister invites farmers of the capital region for relaunch ceremony of Amaravati development works
content: Naidu holds discussions with the farmers regarding their grievances and aspirations at his Undavalli residence

title: Concessional rates for sending textbooks through ‘Gyan Post’
content: The service will have prices ranging from ₹20 to ₹100, for packages ranging from up to 300 grams to 5kg respectively

title: Rejected two-nation theory in 1947: Farooq Abdullah
content: The former CM says he always advocated for talks with Pakistan but one could not even think of talks with a nation that killed innocent people

title: Is there provision for emergency care on highways, SC asks Centre
content: The sharp comments from the Bench came while hearing a case over the delay in the implementation of the cashless scheme for treating road accident victims

title: Karnataka High Court directs State govt. to set up cyber investigation bureau or give life to cyber command centre with expert investigating officers
content: Court sets up SIT headed by DGP Pronab Mohaty to probe a case of alleged stealing of data from a private company supplying drones to defence sector

title: War is not an option; this is not a bad time to restore Statehood to J&K, says former RAW chief A.S. Dulat
content: ‘For the time being, everybody in Kashmir is one and all the Kashmiri leaders have said they are with Delhi...whatever the Government of India does, it should ensure to take the local Kashmiri along,’ Amarjit Singh Dulat, who has written extensively on J&K, said

title: A.P. CID police invite applications for home guard posts
content: Applications can be downloaded from https://cid.appolice.gov.in, and must be submitted between May 1 to 15, 2025.

title: Tripura police target netizens for criticising security lapses in Kashmir
content: Sources say that at least seven people have recently been arrested, and many others are wanted for their posts discussing the security situation in Kashmir

title: Mayor’s helpdesk set to open at Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: Helpdesk will aid people, especially senior citizens, who have been finding it hard to use the government’s K-Smart platform. Personnel will also assist people in approaching the relevant section for various needs

title: Preterm newborn undergoes rare liver tumour resection at private hospital in Bengaluru
content: The male baby, born at 33 weeks on February 5 in a private hospital, started facing breathing difficulty

title: Human Rights Commission begins inquiry into Hubballi police encountering accused
content: The accused in a minor girl’s murder died after being shot at by police when he tried to escape after assaulting them

title: Actors Shine Tom Chacko, Sreenath Bhasi appear before excise team for questioning
content: Both actors and a model reportedly deny drug dealings with the accused persons in the hybrid ganja case. Shine shifted to de-addiction centre

title: Forest department to strengthen local committees to tackle human-wildlife conflicts in Kerala
content: District-level committees will convene every month to assess the situation on the ground and adopt necessary action

title: Idukki diocese seeks immediate solution to construction curbs in the hill district
content: The basic rights of Idukki people are in limbo due to the restriction on construction activities says Idukki Bishop

title: Call to name Mananchira-Vellimadukunnu road after MGS
content: The committee said that the completion of the road was the last wish of MGS, which he had mentioned in his final letter to Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari

title: KSEB seeks revival of Athirappilly hydel project with a tourism twist
content: The contentious 163 MW hydel project planned at Athirappilly has remained in limbo for years, although the KSEB had never officially abandoned it

title: Kerosene distribution to resume in Kerala after nearly two years
content: Centre allocates 5,676 kilolitres of kerosene. Dearth of licensed wholesale dealers posing hurdles to distribution

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent the past month searching for an answer . he can build on his 53 tackles last season, after which he landed a six-figure name, image and likeness contract with the school . the market for defensive backs is booming, his agents say .

title: Garcia? Teofimo? Canelo? Inoue? A Lapsed fan's guide to boxing's biggest weekend of 2025
content: this weekend will see three consecutive nights of fight cards featuring four current or former ESPN pound-for-pound fighters . Easily the most unique location of the weekend is Times Square in New York City, where Garcia, Haney and Lopez will compete in separate fights in the renowned public space .

title: 32 teams, 32 questions, 32 answers: Taking stock of what's ahead this offseason
content: the 2025 NFL draft wrapped up in green Bay, Wisconsin . there are 257 new faces joining the league, but will they help solve teams' woes? what questions linger after the three-day player selection extravaganza .

title: Pistons' adjustments, Warriors' needs: What we learned in the first week of the playoffs
content: the first round of the 2025 playoffs is entering its second week . we've already seen some intriguing matchups, including a sweep of the no. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies by the No. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder . the four top-seeded teams are on the brink of punching their tickets to the second round .

title: Follow live: Cavs look to complete sweep of Heat
content: Content extraction failed.

title: 6-team mock draft: How early did Paige Bueckers go?
content: the 2025 WNBA season is set to tip off on may 16, the ESPN experts came together for a fantasy women's basketball mock draft . we used the default settings -- a six-team league with nine players per team and the following scoring system . the participants of this mock draft were Charlie Creme, Eric Moody, Jason Shebilske, andre Snellings .

title: College baseball Week 11: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the longhorns remain the top of the class in all of baseball and the SEC . but it was the only top team to hold onto its spot as the rest of the top 10 underwent quite a shakeup . this week's biggest climber is NC State, which jumped 12 spots to no. 13 after sweeping Clemson .
